title: Quiz 9: Benign Gynaecological Tumours
description: Assess your knowledge of benign tumours like fibroids, ovarian cysts, and their management.

questions.question: Match the location of the Uterine Fibroid with its name:

richContent.content: Fibroids are named by where they grow in the uterus.

pairs.right: Outside the uterus, under the peritoneum
Just under the endometrium, often projecting into cavity

questions.explanation: Standard classification based on uterine layers.

questions.question: Which symptom is the most common reason a patient with fibroids seeks medical advice?
questions.explanation: Fibroids increase the surface area of the endometrium, leading to heavy bleeding (menorrhagia). Pain is rare unless complicated.

questions.question: The surgical removal of fibroids while retaining the uterus is called ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Myomectomy removes the myoma (fibroid) only. Hysterectomy removes the uterus.

questions.question: Which ovarian cyst is known as a 'chocolate cyst'?
questions.explanation: Old blood in a cyst (often from endometriosis) becomes thick and dark, resembling chocolate.

questions.question: Fibroids usually continue to grow rapidly after menopause.
questions.explanation: Fibroids are estrogen-dependent. After menopause (when estrogen drops), they usually cease growing or shrink.

questions.question: Arrange the steps in the management of a benign breast lump (Mammary Dysplasia):
questions.explanation: Always rule out cancer first, then treat/drain, check fluid, and follow up.

questions.question: Which of the following are complications of ovarian tumours? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Torsion, rupture, and haemorrhage are acute complications. Infection is less common.

questions.question: What is the most common benign ovarian neoplasm that can reach an enormous size?
questions.explanation: Mucinous cystadenoma is the most common and can grow very large, distending the abdomen.

questions.question: Which benign breast tumour is common in young women (under 30) and is firm, discrete, and movable?
questions.explanation: Fibroadenoma is the typical 'breast mouse' (movable lump) in young women.

questions.question: When is a Hysterectomy indicated for fibroids? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Patient wants to have more children

questions.explanation: Hysterectomy ends fertility, so it's for older women or when complications/malignancy risks are high.
questions.hint: Think about preserving fertility vs removing the disease.
